title: corrupting potion Vs magic resist
body:
Is corrupting potions on-hit magic damage reduced by magic resistance?
I don't seem to be able to find an answer anywhere.

replies.body:
ALL magic damage is reduced by MR.

If it were going through MR, it would be true damage.

Is there anywhere i can confirm that it actually is reduced by magic resistance and hasn't been overlooked. Because I went up against a Malphite the other day, and he seemed to do huge amounts of damage using only corrupting potion despite the fact that i had large amounts of MR as sion.

While i can't think of anywhere to confirm it, i can basically guarantee that it works that way.

The issue is that your MR won't be super effective just because of how it works.

If you have 100 MR, you are still getting hit with between 7-15 Magic damage per second, and this adds up fairly quickly (and is why a champion like singed ALWAYS runs corrupting potion.).
okay, thanks for you help mate.
